chapter.title: OpenStack Training Guides Are Under Construction
chapter.para: We need your help! This is a community driven project to reuse as much of the existing documentation as possible. We cannot make this work without your help. There is an easy way to contribute to this effort. Look at the end of end section and you will see the Submit a Bug link. When you find something that can be improved or fixed, submit a bug!
Look below for more details on the OpenStack Training project.

listitem.para: OpenStack Training Wiki (describes the project in detail)
OpenStack Training blueprint(this is the key project page)
Bi-Weekly SFBay Hackathon meetup page(we discuss project details with all team members)
Core Training Weekly Meeting Agenda(we review project action items here)
Core Training Trello/KanBan storyboard(we develop high level project action items here)

chapter.para:
Three different levels of contribution:
Extended Education Team
Use the OpenStack Training material at docs.openstack.org/trunk/training. If you find a mistake or something that can be improved use the link at the end of end section and submit a bug.
Community Team
We need Community Team members to take ownership of fixing up a section of the material at a time.
Assign a user story from the Sprint Backlog to yourself
Create a bp/training-manuals branch (e.g. git branch -b bp/training-manuals)
Use the templatebookstub-general-templatestub.xml as the starting point for your user story.associate-general.xml is also a good example for XML syntax.
When your editing is completed. Double check Oxygen doesn't have any errors you are not expecting.
Run maven locally to verify the build will run without errors (e.g. mvn clean generate-sources)
Follow the rest of the steps in the Fix a Documentation Bug section in the Fix a Bug chapter
We also have bugs that need fixing. Monitor the blueprint page herehttps://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+spec/training-manuals and fix a bug.
Optional attendance at the weekly IRC meetings
Core Team
Manditory attendance at the weekly IRC meetings
Manditory attendance at the Day Sprints when called
Review patches and bugs
Take up Community Team member responsibilties as well time permitting
Find the userstory-includes-template.xml file in the /openstack-training/ directory for syntax on how to create your user stories
